com.cognifide.slice.api.provider

Interface ModelProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SliceModelProvider

    @ProviderType
public interface ModelProvider
    A base interface in Slice. It allows to fetch an injectable object(s) mapped from specified resource or path. It resembles Guice com.google.inject.Injector in being used for fetching objects of different classes but it is closely tied to Slice because it also support mappings of requested objects with data obtained from specified resources. ModelProvider can be also injected directly to your models, so that you can read a model from an arbitrary resource or path, e.g.: 
      @SliceResource
  public class OrderModel {
 
    private final static String CONFIGURATION_PATH = "/content/app/configuration/jcr:content/currency";
    private final ModelProvider modelProvider;
 
    @JcrProperty
    private int value;
 
    @Inject
    public OrderModel(ModelProvider modelProvider) {
      this.modelProvider = modelProvider;
    }
 
    public int getValue() {
      Currency currency = modelProvider.get(Currency.class, CONFIGURATION_PATH);
      return formatToCurrency(value, currency);
    }
  ...
  }
    All methods of ModelProvider are thread safe

    • Method Detail

      • get

        <T> T get(Class<T> type,
        String path)
        Instantiates an object of specified type using Guice injector. Additionally, Slice remembers the resource of specified path internally, so it can be either injected or used for mapping of objects annotated with SliceResource. Mapping is triggered automatically by Slice (with use of Mapper), so if the specified class is annotated with SliceResource it will be mapped from specified resource.

        Please note that objects which are injected to instantiated one, can also leverage specified resource, so they can also be mapped automatically. Let's consider an example. 
          @SliceResource
  public class Order {
    @JcrProperty
    String orderProperty;
    
    @Inject
    public Order(Currency currency) {
    ..
    }
  ..
  }
  
  @SliceResource
  public class Currency {
    @JcrProperty
    String currencyProperty;
   ..
  }
  ..
  modelProvider.get(Order.class, "/content/app/orders/order1");
        In above execution, both Order and Currency objects will be mapped from resource defined by /content/app/orders/order1. It means that the above code expects the resource to contain two properties: orderProperty, currencyProperty.

        It is possible to use absolute and relative (with "./" prefix) paths in recursive calls. All get methods are invoked with Context that was used to create this ModelProvider. Example: 
          modelProvider.get(Order.class, "/content/app/orders/order1");
   
  public class Order {
    @Inject
    public Order(ModelProvider modelProvider) {
       modelProvider.get(Currency.class, "./currency");
    }
  }
        In above case, Currency object will be mapped from a resource defined by /content/app/orders/order1/currency.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of object to be created
        Parameters:
        type - class of object to be created
        path - Path to a resource which will be used to map @SliceResource objects
        Returns:
        instantiated object of specified type. If the type is annotated by SliceResource it will be mapped from resource from under specified path

      • get

        <T> T get(Class<T> type,
        org.apache.sling.api.resource.Resource resource)
        Instantiates an object of specified type using Guice injector and map it from specified resource. It works exactly as get(type, path).
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of object to be created
        Parameters:
        type - class of object to be created
        resource - resource which will be used to map @SliceResource objects
        Returns:
        instantiated object of specified type. If the type is annotated by SliceResource it will be mapped from resource from under specified path

      • get

        <T> T get(com.google.inject.Key<T> key,
        org.apache.sling.api.resource.Resource resource)
        Instantiates an object of specified type using Guice injector and specified Key. It maps the object from specified resource, exactly as described in get(type, path).
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of model object to be created
        Parameters:
        key - a Guice Key which defines binding to a required object
        resource - resource which will be used to map @SliceResource objects
        Returns:
        instantiated object of specified type. If the type is annotated by SliceResource it will be mapped from resource from under specified path
        See Also:
        Injector.getInstance(Key)

      • get

        <T> T get(com.google.inject.Key<T> key,
        String path)
        Instantiates an object of specified type using Guice injector and specified Key. It maps the object from specified resource, exactly as described in get(type, path).
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of model object to be created
        Parameters:
        key - a Guice Key which defines binding to a required object
        path - path to a resource which will be used to map @SliceResource objects
        Returns:
        instantiated object of specified type. If the type is annotated by SliceResource it will be mapped from resource from under specified path
        See Also:
        Injector.getInstance(Key)

      • get

        Object get(String className,
         String path)
           throws ClassNotFoundException
        Instantiates an object of specified type using Guice injector and map it from specified resource. It works exactly as get(type, path).
        Parameters:
        className - canonical name of a class to be resolved, e.g. com.cognifide.slice.api.ModelProvider
        path - path to a resource which will be used to map @SliceResource objects
        Returns:
        instantiated object of specified type. If the type is annotated by SliceResource it will be mapped from resource from under specified path
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if specified className cannot be loaded

      • get

        Object get(String className,
         org.apache.sling.api.resource.Resource resource)
           throws ClassNotFoundException
        Instantiates an object of specified type using Guice injector and map it from specified resource. It works exactly as get(type, path).
        Parameters:
        className - canonical name of a class to be resolved, e.g. com.cognifide.example.MyClass
        resource - resource which will be used to map @SliceResource objects
        Returns:
        instantiated object of specified type. If the type is annotated by SliceResource it will be mapped from resource from under specified path
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if specified className cannot be loaded

      • get

        Object get(org.apache.sling.api.resource.Resource resource)
           throws ClassNotFoundException
        Creates new model object of type specified by the slice:model property defined in the component definition resource (basically resource indicated by sling:resourceType). It works exactly as get(String, Resource) where String property is read from component definition resource.
        Parameters:
        resource - resource which will be used to map @SliceResource objects
        Returns:
        model object from given resource or null if there is no slice:model property in component definition resource
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if class found under slice:model cannot be loaded

      • getList

        <T> List<T> getList(Class<T> type,
                  Iterator<String> paths)
        This is convenience method that works exactly like getListFromResources(Class, Iterator)
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of model objects to be created
        Parameters:
        type - class of model objects to be created
        paths - iterator that returns paths to resources from which objects will be mapped
        Returns:
        list of model objects mapped from given resources. If the resource iterator has no element or is null, then an empty list is returned. It never returns null.

      • getList

        <T> List<T> getList(Class<T> type,
                  String[] paths)
        This is convenience method that works exactly like getList(Class, Iterator)
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of model objects to create
        Parameters:
        type - class of model objects to create
        paths - array of Sling repository paths to create objects from
        Returns:
        list of model objects from given Sling repository paths

      • getChildModels

        <T> List<T> getChildModels(Class<T> type,
                         String parentPath)
        This is a convenience method working exactly like getChildModels(Class, Resource)
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of model objects to create
        Parameters:
        type - class of model objects to create
        parentPath - Sling resource path to obtain children (could be relative)
        Returns:
        list of model objects from given Sling repository paths or empty list if parentPath is invalid

      • getChildModels

        <T> List<T> getChildModels(Class<T> type,
                         org.apache.sling.api.resource.Resource parentResource)
        This method lists children of the given resource via parentResource.listChildren(), invokes get(Class, Resource) for each of them and returns a List containing mapped models. If the parentResource is null or doesn't exist, an empty list will be returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of model objects to be created
        Parameters:
        type - class of model objects to be created
        parentResource - Sling resource to obtain children resources
        Returns:
        list of model objects from given Sling repository paths or empty list if parentResource is null or doesn't exist

      • getListFromResources

        <T> List<T> getListFromResources(Class<T> type,
                               Iterator<org.apache.sling.api.resource.Resource> resources)
        Creates list of models of type T from specified resources. Each resource from specified iterator is mapped to a class T
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of model objects to create
        Parameters:
        type - class of model objects to create
        resources - iterator that returns Sling repository resources to create objects from
        Returns:
        list of model objects mapped from given resources. If the resource iterator has no element or is null, then an empty list is returned. It never returns null.
